content.question: Which of the following statements best describes an unintended environmental consequence of aquaculture fish-farm enclosures located in estuaries?

choices.label: Fish farms create waste that contaminates potential drinking-water resources for coastal communities.
Aquaculture can decrease pressures on overexploited fisheries, increasing fish populations.
Cultivated fish can escape and breed with wild populations, increasing the population size of wild fish in coastal waters.
Aquaculture enclosures can harbor parasites that can negatively affect wild populations that breed in estuaries.

content.answer: Aquaculture enclosures can harbor parasites that can negatively affect wild populations that breed in estuaries.

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Describe disadvantages, advantages, or unintended consequences for potential solutions.
